verses.kjv: Now we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and by our gathering together unto him,
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, regarding the return of our Lord Jesus Christ and our being gathered to him, we ask you

verses.kjv: That ye be not soon shaken in mind, or be troubled, neither by spirit, nor by word, nor by letter as from us, as that the day of Christ is at hand.
verses.ct: not to be quickly unsettled or alarmed — whether by some prophecy, some statement, or some letter supposedly from us — claiming that the day of Christ has already arrived.

verses.kjv: Let no man deceive you by any means: for that day shall not come, except there come a falling away first, and that man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition;
verses.ct: Don't let anyone mislead you in any way. That day will not come until the great rebellion happens first and the man of sin is exposed — the one destined for destruction.

verses.kjv: Who opposeth and exalteth himself above all that is called God, or that is worshipped; so that he as God sitteth in the temple of God, shewing himself that he is God.
verses.ct: He opposes and elevates himself over everything called God or everything that is worshiped, so that he takes his seat in God's temple, declaring himself to be God.

verses.kjv: Remember ye not, that, when I was yet with you, I told you these things?
verses.ct: Don't you remember that I explained all of this to you when I was still there with you?

verses.kjv: And now ye know what withholdeth that he might be revealed in his time.
verses.ct: You also know what is currently holding him back, so that he will be exposed only at the proper time.

verses.kjv: For the mystery of iniquity doth already work: only he who now letteth will let, until he be taken out of the way.
verses.ct: The hidden power of lawlessness is already at work, but the one who is restraining it will continue to do so until he is removed.

verses.kjv: And then shall that Wicked be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with the spirit of his mouth, and shall destroy with the brightness of his coming:
verses.ct: Then the lawless one will be exposed, and the Lord will destroy him with the breath of his mouth and wipe him out by the splendor of his coming.

verses.kjv: Even him, whose coming is after the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders,
verses.ct: The arrival of this lawless one will be empowered by Satan, accompanied by every kind of counterfeit power, signs, and false wonders.

verses.kjv: And with all deceivableness of unrighteousness in them that perish; because they received not the love of the truth, that they might be saved.
verses.ct: He will use every form of wicked deception against those who are headed for destruction, because they refused to embrace the truth that could have saved them.

verses.kjv: And for this cause God shall send them strong delusion, that they should believe a lie:
verses.ct: Because of this, God will send them a powerful delusion so that they will believe what is false.

verses.kjv: That they all might be damned who believed not the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness.
verses.ct: The result is that all who did not believe the truth but instead took pleasure in wickedness will be condemned.

verses.kjv: But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you, brethren beloved of the Lord, because God hath from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth:
verses.ct: But we always have reason to thank God for you, brothers and sisters loved by the Lord, because from the beginning God chose you for salvation through the sanctifying work of the Spirit and through your belief in the truth.

verses.kjv: Whereunto he called you by our gospel, to the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: This is what he called you to through the good news we shared with you — so that you would share in the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Therefore, brethren, stand fast, and hold the traditions which ye have been taught, whether by word, or our epistle.
verses.ct: So then, brothers and sisters, stand firm and hold on to the teachings we passed on to you, whether spoken in person or written in our letters.

verses.kjv: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace,
verses.ct: May our Lord Jesus Christ himself and God our Father — who has loved us and through grace has given us eternal encouragement and a wonderful hope —

verses.kjv: Comfort your hearts, and stablish you in every good word and work.
verses.ct: strengthen your hearts and establish you in every good thing you say and do.
